Now?</h1><div class="bdc-1jv767p-ProfileWrapper e1fuw8ud1"><div class="bdc-gbpq26-BDCProfileWrapper e1fuw8ud2"><img alt="author image" loading="lazy" width="60" height="60" decoding="async" class="bdc-woa1k-FlexBox e1fuw8ud11"><div class="bdc-15ogl6a-NameAndTypeWrapper e1fuw8ud12"><a class=" bdc-v0rk73-LinkWrapper e12kotym0" href="https://www.business.com/author/jennifer-dublino/"><span e1mafc6t3"><div class="bdc-gymzv0-HeadlineWrapper e1mafc6t4"><h3 class="bdc-17tqx49-Headline e1mafc6t5">Table of Contents</h3><span><svg height="8px" width="12px" version="1.1" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" x="0px" y="0px" viewBox="0 0 22.5 11.4" style="transform:rotate(180deg)" xml:space="preserve" role="img" aria-labelledby="chevron-icon-Rkpkb59t6"><title id="chevron-icon-Rkpkb59t6">Open row</title><polyline fill="none" stroke="#000000" stroke-width="4" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-miterlimit="10" points="21.4,10.4 11.2,1 1,10.4 "></polyline></svg></span></div></section><div class="e1ddf8qf1 bdc-1ky34x4-GenericContainerStyles-PageContent en5fl9z0"><div class="bdc-8xnbex-Content e17uhh4v0"><div><p>As times change and societal shifts occur, customer expectations evolve. Innovations like e-commerce and online reviews give consumers more power, and tech advances help businesses provide higher service levels. The COVID-19 pandemic changed how people shop, and these more discerning customer expectations – including heightened service levels that <a class=" bdc-v0rk73-LinkWrapper e12kotym0" href="/articles/what-drives-successful-customer-satisfaction/">drive customer satisfaction</a> – may be here to say. </p><p>To stay competitive, businesses must respond to changing industry dynamics and escalating customer expectations. An integrated, omnichannel customer service strategy might be the only way to deliver a truly <a class=" bdc-v0rk73-LinkWrapper e12kotym0" href="/articles/customer-delight-the-new-standard-in-customer-service/">delightful customer experience</a>.</p><p>We’ll explore what a great customer experience looks like today and what customers expect from the companies they do business with. </p><section class="bdc-myy83k-TipBoxWrapper ejdh7lz7"><div class="bdc-10tvdsy-Header ejdh7lz0"><div class="bdc-1bj2gra-HeaderContentWrapper ejdh7lz3"><span>Did You Know?</span><svg width="30" height="30" viewBox="0 0 30 30" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" aria-labelledby="bdc-did-you-know-icon-R59kjakb59t6"><title id="bdc-did-you-know-icon-R59kjakb59t6">Did you know</title><rect width="30" height="30" rx="15" fill="#E5FC56"></rect><g clip-path="url(#clip-R59kjakb59t6H1)"><path d="M14.64 10.8H16.56V12.72H14.64V10.8ZM14.64 14.64H16.56V20.4H14.64V14.64ZM15.6 6C10.3008 6 6 10.3008 6 15.6C6 20.8992 10.3008 25.2 15.6 25.2C20.8992 25.2 25.2 20.8992 25.2 15.6C25.2 10.3008 20.8992 6 15.6 6ZM15.6 23.28C11.3664 23.28 7.92 19.8336 7.92 15.6C7.92 11.3664 11.3664 7.92 15.6 7.92C19.8336 7.92 23.28 11.3664 23.28 15.6C23.28 19.8336 19.8336 23.28 15.6 23.28Z" fill="#000000"></path></g><defs><clipPath id="clip-R59kjakb59t6H1"><rect width="19.2" height="19.2" fill="white" transform="translate(6 6)"></rect></clipPath></defs></svg></div></div><div class="bdc-1479fiq-Body ejdh7lz1"><div class="bdc-19q5h0k-BodyContentWrapper ejdh7lz2"><div data-gtm="tip-box-content" class="bdc-c6ofbn-ParsedContent ejdh7lz6"><p>An excellent customer experience can pay enormous dividends for businesses. According to research from <a href="https://cdn2.hubspot.net/hubfs/2771217/Content/2018%20Customer%20Service%20Expectations%20Gladly.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Gladly</a>, almost 70% of customers said they are willing to pay more for a brand or provider with a <a href="/articles/protect-brand-reputation/">brand reputation</a> for outstanding customer service.</p>
</div></div></div></section><section id="what-a-great-customer-experience-looks-like"><h2 class="wp-block-heading">What a great customer experience looks like</h2><p>According to a <a class=" bdc-v0rk73-LinkWrapper e12kotym0" href="https://www.kustomer.com/guides/what-consumers-expect-from-the-customer-experience/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Kustomer</a> survey of what consumers want, customers expect much more from companies they buy from. They are also willing to reward companies that meet their expectations with <a class=" bdc-v0rk73-LinkWrapper e12kotym0" href="/articles/what-makes-customer-loyalty-so-important/">customer loyalty</a> and increased sales. Here are some ways to avoid customer service pitfalls and provide a standout customer experience. </p><h3>1. Demonstrate value to provide a great customer experience.</h3><p>Customers want to feel like the product or service you provide is a good value, both overall and in relation to price. This expectation doesn’t mean you must charge excessively low prices. Value includes additional factors like <a class=" bdc-v0rk73-LinkWrapper e12kotym0" href="/articles/5-reasons-why-product-quality-matters/">product quality</a>, customer support, relevant content, loyalty programs, and community-building. </p><p>When customers feel they’ve received a good value, they are more willing to share data and engage with your company.</p><h3>2. Create a speedy experience to satisfy customers.</h3><p>Speed is a key factor in providing <a class=" bdc-v0rk73-LinkWrapper e12kotym0" href="/articles/why-efficient-customer-service-is-better-than-friendly/">efficient customer service</a>. The good news is that customers are happy to have their problems resolved by a chatbot, which can save you money and allow your customer service reps to handle thornier issues.</p><h3>3. Personalize communications to appeal to customers.</h3><p>A <a class=" bdc-v0rk73-LinkWrapper e12kotym0" href="https://www.mckinsey.com/capabilities/growth-marketing-and-sales/our-insights/the-value-of-getting-personalization-right-or-wrong-is-multiplying" target="_blank" rel="noopener">McKinsey</a> survey found that 71% of customers expect companies to deliver personalized interactions. They want businesses to employ a <a class=" bdc-v0rk73-LinkWrapper e12kotym0" href="/articles/5-examples-where-the-personal-touch-still-matters-in-marketing/">personal touch</a> and send only relevant communications. For example, if a customer bought a sweater, they don’t want to receive an email promoting the same sweater, but they’d likely welcome an email promoting pants that would look good with it.</p><p>To effectively personalize your communications, gather data on customers, including:</p><ul><li>Purchase history</li><li>Stated preferences </li><li>Browsing history on your website </li></ul><p>Keep this information in your <a class=" bdc-v0rk73-LinkWrapper e12kotym0" href="/articles/small-business-crm-success/">customer relationship management system (CRM)</a> program and use it to make relevant recommendations. Send recommendations via email and dynamic pages on your website that display items the customer recently viewed and complementary or similar products. </p><p>Personalization should also flow into your customer loyalty program so that once a certain amount of money is spent, you can offer customers a discount on products they’re more likely to buy.</p><h3>4. Communicate with empathy to support customers. </h3><p>When a customer has a problem or complaint, the company’s representatives must empathize with the customer’s predicament. It’s essential to <a class=" bdc-v0rk73-LinkWrapper e12kotym0" href="/articles/emotionally-connecting-with-customers/">emotionally connect with customers</a>, especially if they’re upset. </p><p>Create processes to separate calls from upset customers and move them to the front of the line or to dedicated reps trained in calming customers and resolving high-priority problems. </p><section class="bdc-myy83k-TipBoxWrapper ejdh7lz7"><div class="bdc-10tvdsy-Header ejdh7lz0"><div class="bdc-1bj2gra-HeaderContentWrapper ejdh7lz3"><span>Tip</span><svg width="30" class="bdc-1479fiq-Body ejdh7lz1"><div class="bdc-19q5h0k-BodyContentWrapper ejdh7lz2"><div data-gtm="tip-box-content" class="bdc-c6ofbn-ParsedContent ejdh7lz6"><p>One way to nip customer service issues in the bud is by proactively following up after a purchase to <a href="/articles/how-to-use-customer-feedback/">request customer feedback</a> about their experience.</p>
</div></div></div></section><h3>5. Provide the convenience of omnichannel customer service. </h3><p>Today’s customers quickly switch from websites to social media to email and phone calls. They expect companies to provide seamless service on all these channels. Many customers expect to use <a class=" bdc-v0rk73-LinkWrapper e12kotym0" href="/articles/twitter-as-a-customer-support-channel/">Twitter for customer service</a>, along with email and live chat options. </p><p>All your customer service channels should be integrated so that customers can track their issues no matter their channel or device. </p><p>Omnichannel customer service eliminates several common customer frustration points, including:</p><ul><li>Being transferred to another department when contacting customer service</li><li>Having to repeat information multiple times to different reps</li><li>Getting contradictory or incorrect information</li></ul><p>In addition to omnichannel customer service, offer customers various purchasing options in addition to <a class=" bdc-v0rk73-LinkWrapper e12kotym0" href="https://www.business.com/articles/retail-or-e-tail-buying-online-vs-buying-in-person/">buying online and buying in-person</a>. Consider offering buy-online-pick-up-in-store (BOPIS) options, delivery for in-store purchases, and curbside pickup to maximize customer convenience.</p><section class="bdc-myy83k-TipBoxWrapper ejdh7lz7"><div class="bdc-10tvdsy-Header ejdh7lz0"><div class="bdc-1bj2gra-HeaderContentWrapper ejdh7lz3"><span>Tip</span><svg width="30" height="30" viewBox="0 0 30 30" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" aria-labelledby="bdc-tip-icon-R59m5jakb59t6"><title id="bdc-tip-icon-R59m5jakb59t6">Bottom line</title><rect width="30" height="30" rx="15" fill="#E5FC56"></rect><g clip-path="url(#clip-R59m5jakb59t6H1)"><path d="M12.2404 24.24C12.2404 24.768 12.6724 25.2 13.2004 25.2H17.0404C17.5684 25.2 18.0004 24.768 18.0004 24.24V23.28H12.2404V24.24ZM15.1204 6C11.4148 6 8.40039 9.0144 8.40039 12.72C8.40039 15.0048 9.54279 17.0112 11.2804 18.2304V20.4C11.2804 20.928 11.7124 21.36 12.2404 21.36H18.0004C18.5284 21.36 18.9604 20.928 18.9604 20.4V18.2304C20.698 17.0112 21.8404 15.0048 21.8404 12.72C21.8404 9.0144 18.826 6 15.1204 6ZM17.8564 16.656L17.0404 17.232V19.44H13.2004V17.232L12.3844 16.656C11.0884 15.7536 10.3204 14.2848 10.3204 12.72C10.3204 10.0704 12.4708 7.92 15.1204 7.92C17.77 7.92 19.9204 10.0704 19.9204 12.72C19.9204 14.2848 19.1524 15.7536 17.8564 16.656Z" fill="#000000"></path></g><defs><clipPath id="clip-R59m5jakb59t6H1"><rect width="19.2" height="19.2" fill="white" transform="translate(6 6)"></rect></clipPath></defs></svg></div></div><div class="bdc-1479fiq-Body ejdh7lz1"><div class="bdc-19q5h0k-BodyContentWrapper ejdh7lz2"><div data-gtm="tip-box-content" class="bdc-c6ofbn-ParsedContent ejdh7lz6"><p>To <a href="/articles/keep-customers-on-your-website/">keep customers on your website and boost sales</a>, use pop-up opt-ins to ask them to subscribe to your email list, boost your site speed, and share <a href="/articles/tips-for-getting-positive-reviews/">good customer reviews</a> and testimonials.</p>
</div></div></div></section></section><section id="how-the-customer-experience-changed-after-covid-19"><h2>How the customer experience changed after COVID-19</h2><p>Particularly in times of crisis, every customer interaction with a brand can trigger a lingering effect of trust and loyalty or disconnect. The COVID-19 pandemic changed how people did business and their expectations of companies. Here are some customer experience implications that resulted. </p><h3>1. Customers expect real-time data about product availability and shipping.</h3><p>The pandemic caused unusual product availability disruptions, some of which still linger. Part of the problem is that <a class=" bdc-v0rk73-LinkWrapper e12kotym0" href="/articles/supply-chain-distribution/">supply chain distribution</a> was disrupted. It’s still variable as suppliers adapt to labor shortages, pent-up demand, and limited availability of specific components, especially from overseas. Here are a few things to implement in your systems:</p><ul><li><strong>Provide real-time inventory information</strong>. Because consumers sometimes encounter long wait times for some everyday items, they want to know upfront if your store has their items in stock now. Connecting your store’s inventory software to product pages may require back-end changes, but it will help you bring customers real-time information,  avoid wasting shoppers’ time, and earn and keep their trust. </li><li><strong>Be upfront about shipping</strong>. As always, shoppers expect fast shipping. Current shipping speed information belongs on every page in your online store so customers aren’t surprised at checkout. This will help you <a class=" bdc-v0rk73-LinkWrapper e12kotym0" href="/articles/reduce-shopping-cart-abandonment/">stop shopping cart abandonment</a>.</li><li><strong>Enable purchase tracking</strong>. Your customers also must be able to track their purchases from warehouse to doorstep, which you should offer through your carriers or a third-party package-tracking service. Real-time tracking is essential to show where packages are and to help prevent package theft, which is on the rise.</li></ul><h3>2. Customers expect clear, positive messaging and support.</h3><p>As customers first began falling ill and experiencing financial problems from lost jobs and closures due to the pandemic, they expected companies to respond with understanding and support. While the worst of the pandemic may be over, this expectation has remained. Positive, caring messaging can be a natural extension of <a class=" bdc-v0rk73-LinkWrapper e12kotym0" href="/articles/the-art-of-words-how-to-write-the-perfect-mission-statement/">your company’s mission statement</a>, purpose, and values. </p><p>Consider how your business can help customers cope with current and ongoing issues. Goodwill gestures like extending extra assistance can strengthen brand loyalty. </p><p>Ask the following questions when determining how best to support your customers: </p><ul><li>What will your buyers value? </li><li>Can you offer a free upgrade on shipping speed for in-demand items?</li><li>Can you bundle and discount items often bought together? </li><li>If your site doesn’t already have a customer service chat tool, can you add one to help shoppers get their questions answered quickly? </li></ul><p>Look for the gaps in your customer experience, examine the hardships your customers are facing, and see how you can make things better. Continue supportive outreach efforts whenever a disaster or economic downturn affects your customers.</p><h3>3. Customers expect low-friction checkout and authentication.</h3><p>Brand loyalty is also driven by the ease of the buying experience, which often hinges on the online checkout process. During the pandemic, already-stressed customers did not want to jump through hoops to make an online purchase, and their tolerance for a clunky checkout process has persisted. </p><ul><li><strong>Checkout</strong>. A poorly designed checkout that requires too many steps or feels like an inquisition can lead to cart and merchant abandonment. An easy checkout can make a huge difference, particularly with the 38% of shoppers categorized as “deal chasers,” converting them into loyal customers, according to <a class=" bdc-v0rk73-LinkWrapper e12kotym0" href="https://www.pymnts.com/news/ecommerce/2022/friction-free-checkout-can-turn-deal-chasers-into-loyal-customers/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Pymnts</a>.</li><li><strong>Authentication.</strong> Additionally, how your store authenticates a customer’s identity protects you from fraud while helping to shape the customer’s perception of your brand. Every e-commerce order screening represents a fragile opportunity to earn customers’ loyalty. </li></ul><p>For an easy, frictionless checkout process, utilize the following features: </p><ul><li>Social media sign-in</li><li>Price matching</li><li>Clear refund policy</li><li>Non-automatic online coupons</li><li>Easily navigable cart</li><li>Real-time inventory update</li><li>Progress bar</li><li>Trustmarks</li><li>Multifactor authentication</li><li>Secure account data storage</li></ul><section class="bdc-myy83k-TipBoxWrapper ejdh7lz7"><div data-gtm="tip-box-content" class="bdc-c6ofbn-ParsedContent ejdh7lz6"><p>To <a href="/articles/tips-to-improve-customer-service-on-your-e-commerce-site/">improve e-commerce customer service</a>, provide various service options like live chat support, <a href="/articles/text-message-customer-service/">text message customer service</a>, and toll-free phone numbers so customers can reach you conveniently.</p>
</div></div></div></section></section><section id="know-and-meet-your-customers-current-needs"><h2>Know and meet your customers’ current needs</h2><p>Creating a great customer experience is possible, even during times of significant disruption. Know and meet your customers’ needs, <a class=" bdc-v0rk73-LinkWrapper e12kotym0" href="/articles/leading-with-transparency/">embrace transparency</a> about product availability and shipping, and communicate with empathy to stand out in the increasingly crowded and busy e-commerce landscape.</p><p><em>David Fletcher contributed to the reporting and writing in this article. </em></p></section></div></div><div class="bdc-y5o23r-BottomAuthorWrapper e1hhibsj0"><div class="bdc-1gc4eh0-SocialsWrapper e1hhibsj2"><div class="bdc-1w1pm5s-ShareText e1hhibsj3">Share Provide the convenience of omnichannel customer service. "},{"component":"p","children":["Today’s customers quickly switch from websites to social media to email and phone calls. They expect companies to provide seamless service on all these channels. Many customers expect to use ",{"component":"Link","module":"@jelly/ui","props":{"href":"/articles/twitter-as-a-customer-support-channel/"},"children":"Twitter for customer service"},", along with email and live chat options. "]},{"component":"p","children":"All your customer service channels should be integrated so that customers can track their issues no matter their channel or device. "},{"component":"p","children":"Omnichannel customer service eliminates several common customer frustration points, including:"},{"component":"ul","children":[{"component":"li","children":"Being transferred to another department when contacting customer service"},{"component":"li","children":"Having to repeat information multiple times to different reps"},{"component":"li","children":"Getting contradictory or incorrect information"}]},{"component":"p","children":["In addition to omnichannel customer service, offer customers various purchasing options in addition to ",{"component":"Link","module":"@jelly/ui","props":{"href":"https://www.business.com/articles/retail-or-e-tail-buying-online-vs-buying-in-person/"},"children":"buying online and buying in-person"},". Consider offering buy-online-pick-up-in-store (BOPIS) options, delivery for in-store purchases, and curbside pickup to maximize customer convenience."]},{"component":"TipBox","module":"@jelly/shared","props":{"type":"tip","content":"\u003cp\u003eTo \u003ca href=\"/articles/keep-customers-on-your-website/\"\u003ekeep customers on your website and boost sales\u003c/a\u003e, use pop-up opt-ins to ask them to subscribe to your email list, boost your site speed, and share \u003ca href=\"/articles/tips-for-getting-positive-reviews/\"\u003egood customer reviews\u003c/a\u003e and testimonials.\u003c/p\u003e\n","button":null,"header":"Tip","pageProperties":{}}}]},{"component":"section","props":{"id":"how-the-customer-experience-changed-after-covid-19"},"children":[{"component":"h2","children":"How the customer experience changed after COVID-19"},{"component":"p","children":"Particularly in times of crisis, every customer interaction with a brand can trigger a lingering effect of trust and loyalty or disconnect. The COVID-19 pandemic changed how people did business and their expectations of companies. Here are some customer experience implications that resulted. "},{"component":"h3","children":"1. Customers expect real-time data about product availability and shipping."},{"component":"p","children":["The pandemic caused unusual product availability disruptions, some of which still linger. Part of the problem is that ",{"component":"Link","module":"@jelly/ui","props":{"href":"/articles/supply-chain-distribution/"},"children":"supply chain distribution"}," was disrupted. It’s still variable as suppliers adapt to labor shortages, pent-up demand, and limited availability of specific components, especially from overseas. Here are a few things to implement in your systems:"]},{"component":"ul","children":[{"component":"li","children":[{"component":"strong","children":"Provide real-time inventory information"},". Because consumers sometimes encounter long wait times for some everyday items, they want to know upfront if your store has their items in stock now. Connecting your store’s inventory software to product pages may require back-end changes, but it will help you bring customers real-time information,  avoid wasting shoppers’ time, and earn and keep their trust. "]},{"component":"li","children":[{"component":"strong","children":"Be upfront about shipping"},". As always, shoppers expect fast shipping. Current shipping speed information belongs on every page in your online store so customers aren’t surprised at checkout. This will help you ",{"component":"Link","module":"@jelly/ui","props":{"href":"/articles/reduce-shopping-cart-abandonment/"},"children":"stop shopping cart abandonment"},"."]},{"component":"li","children":[{"component":"strong","children":"Enable purchase tracking"},". Your customers also must be able to track their purchases from warehouse to doorstep, which you should offer through your carriers or a third-party package-tracking service. Real-time tracking is essential to show where packages are and to help prevent package theft, which is on the rise."]}]},{"component":"h3","children":"2. Customers expect clear, positive messaging and support."},{"component":"p","children":["As customers first began falling ill and experiencing financial problems from lost jobs and closures due to the pandemic, they expected companies to respond with understanding and support. While the worst of the pandemic may be over, this expectation has remained. Positive, caring messaging can be a natural extension of ",{"component":"Link","module":"@jelly/ui","props":{"href":"/articles/the-art-of-words-how-to-write-the-perfect-mission-statement/"},"children":"your company’s mission statement"},", purpose, and values. "]},{"component":"p","children":"Consider how your business can help customers cope with current and ongoing issues. Goodwill gestures like extending extra assistance can strengthen brand loyalty. "},{"component":"p","children":"Ask the following questions when determining how best to support your customers: "},{"component":"ul","children":[{"component":"li","children":"What will your buyers value? "},{"component":"li","children":"Can you offer a free upgrade on shipping speed for in-demand items?"},{"component":"li","children":"Can you bundle and discount items often bought together? "},{"component":"li","children":"If your site doesn’t already have a customer service chat tool, can you add one to help shoppers get their questions answered quickly? "}]},{"component":"p","children":"Look for the gaps in your customer experience, examine the hardships your customers are facing, and see how you can make things better. Continue supportive outreach efforts whenever a disaster or economic downturn affects your customers."},{"component":"h3","children":"3. Customers expect low-friction checkout and authentication."},{"component":"p","children":"Brand loyalty is also driven by the ease of the buying experience, which often hinges on the online checkout process. During the pandemic, already-stressed customers did not want to jump through hoops to make an online purchase, and their tolerance for a clunky checkout process has persisted. "},{"component":"ul","children":[{"component":"li","children":[{"component":"strong","children":"Checkout"},". A poorly designed checkout that requires too many steps or feels like an inquisition can lead to cart and merchant abandonment.
